byline.contributor: Omar Al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad.
byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: Defense Dept officials say Islamic State group member Sleiman Daoud al-Afari, chemical weapons specialist who was captured by American forces, has given up detailed information that has already led to airstrikes on group's illicit weapons sites in Iraq and Syria.
lead_paragraph: The prisoner is an Iraqi chemical weapons specialist who provided details about the Islamic State’s cache to military interrogators, Pentagon officials said.

headline.main: ISIS Detainee’s Information Led to 2 U.S. Airstrikes, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Detainee Helps U.S. Destroy Chemical Arms Held by ISIS

snippet: The prisoner is an Iraqi chemical weapons specialist who provided details about the Islamic State’s cache to military interrogators, Pentagon officials said.
